column1: Kudymkar (Russian: Куды́мкар; Komi: Кудымкöр) is a town and the administrative center of Komi-Permyak Okrug of Perm Krai
column3: it was the administrative center of Komi-Permyak Autonomous Okrug
column4: a federal subject of Russia. It is located on the Inva River and on the left bank of its tributary the Kuva; 201 kilometers (125 mi) from Perm by road. Population: 28

column1: It was first mentioned in 1579. In 1931
column2: it was granted urban-type settlement status. In 1938

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kudymkar serves as the administrative center of Komi-Permyak Okrug
column3: an administrative unit with special status within Perm Krai
column5: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column6: it is incorporated separately as the town of krai significance of Kudymkar—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column7: the town of krai significance of Kudymkar is incorporated as Kudymkar Urban Okrug.

column1: Most important companies are OAO "Moloko" (dairy products) and OAO "Myasokombinat" (meat products). There are also some other food industry companies.

column2: 64% of population were Komi-Permyak people; 33% were Russians.Historical population of Kudymkar:

column1: Законодательное собрание Коми-Пермяцкого автономного округа. Закон №54 от 4 июля 2005 г. «Об утверждении границ и о наделении статусом муниципального образования "Город Кудымкар" Пермского края»
column2: в ред. Закона №499-ПК от 16 октября 2009 г «О внесении изменений в отдельные законодательные акты Пермской области и Коми-Пермяцкого автономного округа». Вступил в силу через десять дней со дня официального опубликования. Опубликован: "Парма"
